reviews.text:
I would give it 3 1/2 stars. It's not bad. If you like history and cruise ships than this would be great for you.

It's a neat experience, if I stayed here again I would want a suit. The restaurant / Bar has good food and drinks. There are ghost tours and shows you can also check out. 

It's worth staying at least once.

Great tour investigating the paranormal side of the ship. The history is very interesting and the room was literally a breath of fresh air. The rooms were clean and we'll tended to. LOTS of storage space in the historical antique cabinets. The bathroom was very neat too. You just have to see for yourself. The ship has a wide variety of sights to see! More than one day/trip is a must; in order to see everything about this amazing historical ship!

I walked through the Queen Mary independently and did not take one of the tours. It was still totally worth it. So much history on display with good signage especially in the infirmary. My favorite part were the short films called Voices of Queen Mary. Wonderful!! I also enjoyed the information shared by the gentlemen in the navigation room about the methods of communication. The beauty of the ship has been maintained so it is easy to imagine its grandeur as an ocean liner.

Beautiful boat! We are staying here a week at the hotel. Everyone has been outstanding. We met Margaret who's in security, very nice! We also met Richard who was the maintenance man who was very knowledgeable and helpful. I would highly recommend coming here if you're on vacation in California or just visiting and they also give tours of the Queen Mary to their non hotel guests as well. Plus there are beautiful views of long Beach from the restaurant!

Took my daughter here for the first time. Not sure why it took so long to check it out but it was pretty amazing. The Tour Guides are very informative on the history of the ship. A lot to see and explore. You can feel the energy of the place. The amount of people who have been on it is in the millions. Finding out that Liberace would give the lower class passengers a free concert anytime he took a trip on it is pretty cool. The piano he would play is on display. The craftsmanship and quality of the build is incredible. There are still tours and shows we have not seen. Will definitely go back. Highly recommend you take your family to see this amazing piece of history.

I would give it 3 1/2 stars. It's not bad. If you like history and cruise ships than this would be great for you.

It's a neat experience, if I stayed here again I would want a suit. The restaurant / Bar has good food and drinks. There are ghost tours and shows you can also check out. 

It's worth staying at least once.

Great tour investigating the paranormal side of the ship. The history is very interesting and the room was literally a breath of fresh air. The rooms were clean and we'll tended to. LOTS of storage space in the historical antique cabinets. The bathroom was very neat too. You just have to see for yourself. The ship has a wide variety of sights to see! More than one day/trip is a must; in order to see everything about this amazing historical ship!

I walked through the Queen Mary independently and did not take one of the tours. It was still totally worth it. So much history on display with good signage especially in the infirmary. My favorite part were the short films called Voices of Queen Mary. Wonderful!! I also enjoyed the information shared by the gentlemen in the navigation room about the methods of communication. The beauty of the ship has been maintained so it is easy to imagine its grandeur as an ocean liner.

Beautiful boat! We are staying here a week at the hotel. Everyone has been outstanding. We met Margaret who's in security, very nice! We also met Richard who was the maintenance man who was very knowledgeable and helpful. I would highly recommend coming here if you're on vacation in California or just visiting and they also give tours of the Queen Mary to their non hotel guests as well. Plus there are beautiful views of long Beach from the restaurant!

Took my daughter here for the first time. Not sure why it took so long to check it out but it was pretty amazing. The Tour Guides are very informative on the history of the ship. A lot to see and explore. You can feel the energy of the place. The amount of people who have been on it is in the millions. Finding out that Liberace would give the lower class passengers a free concert anytime he took a trip on it is pretty cool. The piano he would play is on display. The craftsmanship and quality of the build is incredible. There are still tours and shows we have not seen. Will definitely go back. Highly recommend you take your family to see this amazing piece of history.

Earl Burns Miller Japanese Garden is real Gem of California state University at Long Beach. It is very small garden Inside the University campus. Garden is truly Japanese in style. There is very shooting and meditative music always. This garden is really stress buster for students. For general public it is having entry ticket of 10 USD. Which is one kind of donation to keep garden up to date.

Located in Cal State University Long Beach, this gorgeous Japanese Garden features a beautiful pond, koi fish, bridges and various plants. This location can also be used for weddings! Lots of picture perfect scenes and the garden changes with the season. Every year the garden does a koi fish auction...definitely not to be missed! Hourly parking available. Restrooms located inside garden.

First, this is a really lovely garden, well worth the visit. It's very small, but it's so well designed and laid out, that it feels spacious. Upon entering, you feel the tranquility in your bones. The plantings are lovely, and there are a great many happy, fat koi to watch and feed. It's delightful. The $5 entrance fee seems to be something kind of recent, but frankly, if they need to to keep the place in pristine condition, then it's money well spent. The bad part, and for me it was quite bad, was that you need to pay for parking, and it wasn't clear to me that there was any option but a day pass from the university lot...which is $8! No thanks. The person I was with had seen the garden, so told me to go in and they'd circle while I had a look around. If there's other cheaper parking options, there needs to be better indications, because I certainly never saw it. This knocks a couple of points of my rating.
Tranquil and beautiful! I love coming here to walk among the carefully tended plants of the garden and along koi filled pond. It is truly an oasis in the midst of the city.
Beautiful, small, elegant. A little tranquil spot on campus. Students are taking naps there because it's so peaceful. Beautiful to look at!

Our docent was amazing.  She shared with us practical historical illustrations on how people lived their daily lives at the house.  Some of those historic items were even available to view! The house and artifacts are very well kept.  Strongly recommend getting the tour.

We visited here and it was nice to get in a little education on our vacation, I'm no history buff so I was surprised how much I learned and how much I enjoyed myself doing it. My 6 year old was ready to leave Disney by 2:00 she didn't want to leave this place so it is definitely worth checking out 😀
The gardens are beautiful 🌹

Our docent gave us a pre-tour while we were waiting for another group to join us. We received so much information about the history of the area in that little bit of time. You must see the video downstairs to appreciate the original builders of this part of the country they created. The biggest part of the tour was the large complex next to the visitors center. Finally, we were shown a section of the outside wall where the original Bixby occupants marked their heights on the adobe wall. That reminded me of Pompeii where the kids marked graffiti on their walls.

My children and I had a wonderful time visiting the ranch. We took part in the new exhibit being showcased. Refreshments were served, staff was extremely friendly, knowledgeable and helpful. We are able to explore the main house and tour the various rooms. This a great FREE place to visit with family. This is also a great place for field trips and educational outings.
Such a gorgeous and educational day at Rancho Los Cerritos. We went for a Field Trip and the kids had a nice time learning about what like was like during that time.
Great place to visit
So hot the fire won't burn
Great place to acquire some knowledge.

Small Museum but lovely staff.
Please park inside of the Museum's parking lot. do not park in the residential neighborhood.
Friendly staff lots of interesting firefighting equipment and an amazing badge collection

Love this space soo much. In 2018 I saw some amazing exhibitions here including; INK Stories on Skin and Judith Hernandez A Dream is the Shadow of Something Real. This place is singular in its focus on Latin American artist, that usually get overlooked at other places. Large space,  but the exhibitions are curated very well, so it doesn't feel like you're at a loss.  They have talks and an interactive space to "do" art. The gift shop is small  but I really enjoyed some of the things they sell. Love this place, parking is on site or on the street and Sundays are free. Definitely would recommend, if you have time for only one thing in Long Beach make it the MOLAA

Every time I go to the LA area I enjoy the cutting edge exhibits at MOLAA. In Sept., 2018+, this was literally true as one of their special shows was on LA tattoos. In addition to the naval connection to LA and international roots of this body art, various local artists' works were displayed. Also, one section had videos of various people selected who would receive tattoos on specified days during the exhibit. In addition works by two female Latino artists were shown. And do step outside in the walled in back courtyard where sculpture and cacti are displayed together. Currently, the outside café is closed for renovations. Free parking is available in the adjacent lot, and do stop into the museum shop that has gifts related to current exhibits. And enjoy free admission on Sundays thanks to Target.

Molaa has always been a wonderful museum . so many events and nice art. The two gentlemen in the front were amazing and helpful. I can't wait to start planning to attend more events. I love this place.

Every time I go to the LA area I enjoy the cutting edge exhibits at MOLAA. In Sept., 2018+, this was literally true as one of their special shows was on LA tattoos. In addition to the naval connection to LA and international roots of this body art, various local artists' works were displayed. Also, one section had videos of various people selected who would receive tattoos on specified days during the exhibit. In addition works by two female Latino artists were shown. And do step outside in the walled in back courtyard where sculpture and cacti are displayed together. Currently, the outside café is closed for renovations. Free parking is available in the adjacent lot, and do stop into the museum shop that has gifts related to current exhibits. And enjoy free admission on Sundays thanks to Target.

Wonderful art work. Sponsors community events such as the Cultural Alliance. Sundays are free to Long Beach residents. Many Latino artists are responsible for such beautiful productions. Love for the community is exibited in contributions made to youth by offering a summer workshop and memberships to the museum are offered to the public.

This was a nice, quiet little breakfast spot with a lot of options. The waitress was nice and the food was delicious. I enjoyed my breakfast burrito and my friends liked the French toast and pancakes. They also offer Bloody Mary's and other alcoholic options if you want to start your morning off with a kick. I would recommend it.
What a perfect place to grab brunch. Loved the location and the staff was very attentive. Would recommend this to anyone who enjoys food and day drinking 🍻

Lots of the young crowd here, and you won't fit in unless you have dyed your hair some rainbow color. I had scrambled eggs, sausage links, some kind of delicious potato patty made with mushrooms, and two thick wedges of a savory rosemary bread with bottomless coffee. Sat outside by myself and saw lots of other conventioneers identifiable by their big,square plastic nametags on lanyards. Not right at convention center but only a three block walk down Ocean Blvd. to Atlantic. Lovely walk past fabulous historic  buildings.

We got there  at 8 a.m. on a rainy Saturday.  It wasn't too busy then. We were seated quickly. Service was excellent. Food was amazing. About halfway through eating, we realized the place was packed. And there was a line out the door. We're  going back tomorrow a.m. for breakfast again.
The food is always prepared with love and care. The atmosphere is beautiful and the sounds of the Grand Prix on an early morning.... well there's no words to explain that.

This is a great little spot to grab breakfast or lunch. Expect a wait but well worth it. This go round I had the grilled salmon over veggies but I've also had their french toast 🤤 with powdered sugar-both delicious! Staff is incredibly friendly. Grab a pie to go!

A true Long Beach institution. I've been here several times and have never been disappointed. The food is always good. They turn amazing food out of two tiny kitchens. The service is excellent. I recommend going early, or you will have to wait and they might run out of their best items. Personal recommendations for the good are the sour cream pecan coffee cake, any of the muffins, the bacon avocado omelette, cheese pocket French toast, and any of their quiches.
This place is wonderful.   Truly enjoyed my lunch and the pies we brought to our guests were amazing.  Love that they are so good without being overly sweet.

One of the best veggie burgers I have eaten. When we arrived there late morning, by 11 on a Sunday and it was packed. Waited about thirty min to get a table for two but it was totally worth it (if in a hurry take a seat at the counter, it is open seating). We tried the burger special, the burger comes with a drink and a dessert. The coffee had lovely flavor. They have a quite a selection of desserts - pies, cookies, cakes, etc. The person who waited our table was as pleasant as possible given the crowd. We had lemon meringue pie and pumpkin streusel for desserts (part of burger special) and couple of lemon bars to go. The lemon bars are not the best ones we have had. The prices are good value for money. 
Parking is on the street, if not one can try the Dana library parking which has two hour parking.

AMAZING restaurant. The chicken pot pie is my favorite of all I've eaten (and I've eaten a bunch). Very cool, old-school Americana bakery type restaurant that's kept up with the times super well. We went on a saturday night, there seemed to be a bit of a wait to get into a table, but my wife, daughter and I were able to get a seat at the counter right away. 

The friendly staff provided crayons and paper for my daughter to draw on, and she loved her freshly baked blueberry muffin.

All the pies here are baked right at the restaurant, all from the same day, and its just amazing. We had an apple pie with ice-cream on top for dessert and loved it.

What a restaurant. Great place to go, great food, great atmosphere, well done.

Great service. Even at happy hour. Mashed potatoes lived up to expectations. I know that sounds odd.. But how many places actually pull off good mashed potatoes! Steak was good and lobster tail spot on. Try the G&T for a great summer beverage. We Will be back!

The Lighthouse has a great New Years Selection and patio viewing of the fireworks that are let off every year in the bay area of Long Beach. You can also see all the other festivities from this location happening on the Queen Mary. Very pricey restaurant UNLESS you hit their happy hour which I highly recommend. So instead of $30+ for an entree you can enjoy $5-$9 appetizers and reduced price drinks. We went twice during my recent visit to Long Beach. Great atmosphere and happy hour was a lot of fun.

Food is not bad. Really good for the view. Steak was cooked to a great medium rare. That said, could use some more seasoning. The whiskey mule was decent but high in ice. all in all, good experience but I'll try other places next time

Delicious food and drinks. A beautiful view of the pier and the ocean out on the patio. One of the best meals I’ve had in Long Beach. A little on the expensive side but you get what you pay for.

Had absolute excellent service and would definitely recommend to anyone in the Long Beach area.

What a beautiful place! The food was amazingly delicious,  server was awesome,  and the view was amazing.  The salmon burger was tastefully amazing, and the chicken,  shrimp,  and sausage jambalaya was delicious.  For you seafood lover's I highly recommend this place and definitely a must try. I can't forget to mention the Oysters.  They were amazingly tasty.  What better then to order a bottle of champagne and orange juice.  It's called mimosas 😁😁...Just the right way to have brunch. Again, if you want to experience amazing food, and a beautiful view I recommend this place.

I really like this spot great service. Our waitress was Ms. Leia she served us twice but I have eaten there like 4 times me and my boo he lives in LBC. I always come here to visit I love going there. 👍👍😁
Nice people. Food is great but be careful about parking. Enter from main St because side entrance is more for existing

Delicious pies, if you don't feel like baking your own, this is the place to go. Pies taste like you made them at home. I've also had their chicken pot pie, very tasty and filling. Located in a shopping area. Free parking.
Friend & I had breakfast. Good home-type food. Server was really nice.
One of my favorite places to grab breakfast all the waiters and waitresses are really nice never rude

I had never been to a Yard House before, and expected it to be crazy expensive and pretentious. But found it to be very down-to-earth, with prices that (while not cheap) we certainly reasonable. We came here on a chilly night so they were sure to crank up their heat lamps outdoors. Service was great, and efficient. The fish tacos I had were to die for - I would recommend that dish highly! My dad and mom both liked the place also - good atmosphere.

What a great place. We had a group of seven people in town for a conference and all had a great experience. The staff were fun, engaging, and really knew the menu. They made great recommendations to help us all make sense of the 200 draft beers they have on tap and the very wide menu selections. The menu is almost so big that too much choice is no choice, but with help from the great staff, everyone loved their selections. Drinks were great; appetizers were perfect; and all the entrees were done just the way everyone had hoped. All-in-all, we had a blast.

Love this place. Great staff and amazing food. I have never had an issue here at this location. Wait times are average but if you go during a good time or off dinner rush hours you're good. This location has a parking but it can be quite a mess if you come during a busy time. They validate but you can lost walking around for a bit. 

Food - Always start off with the garlic noodles. If they had this appetizer as an entree I would order that. I've tried their sliders and pizza's and they have never disappointed. Now for the main courses I have ordered the chicken enchilada stack, solid great flavors. The Shepard's pie pie is a huge plate. I have tried the burgers as well and never a bad choice. 

Now for the drinks, they have a full bar but they are known for having a large amounts of beer on draft. I like to do a flight and start off with an IPA. I like to try different beers when I come here.

The restaurant is pretty great. Sweet potato fries are spot on for a quick snack while burning time. Louie is an awesome, class A bartender who is super friendly and hospitable! He also makes a mean Moscow mule if that's your poison. I have yet to have a bad experience here!

Beautiful atmosphere and company. Service good, however the pizza we ordered was served cold. We didn't make an issue of it. We have been to multiple locations but love this area the most as my sister was laid to rest at sea there. Thank you.

The food was really good quality but the restaurant was a tad bit musky smelling. I avoided the restroom area because you had a pungent smell. If you go to this restaurant just get seated in the front of the restaurant by the doors and I’m not in the back. The food was very flavorful with a authentic twist.
Great Mexican food! Huge servings and good service.  The booth was kind of small for 4 male adults but still adequate.  The burrito is massive.  The salad is huge

Service here is excellent.  If your server is busy, another will come tend to you.  The only reason for 4 stars is that Margaritas only come blended. The food is great and I will definitely come again.

I've been told about this place for a couple of years. I decided to try it. To be perfectly honest I was disappointed. I ordered the pork shank osso bucco on rice. Not so good in my opinion. Customer service was great the atmosphere was fine but the rice was extremely overcooked more like pudding. I won't be back.
Service was very good, as always. Food was hot, as always. Bill was correct, as alwsys. Love the food and we'll worth every penny.
Consistently delicious.  I would say a local favorite.  The Baja Burrito is amazing.  Also the deep fried hard shell tacos.  The best!  Its our regular Friday night dinner place.

Awesome place to eat. Reasonable prices, great mexican food and impeccable service! My wife loves the hot salsa, and I love the mild salsa. Even the soda selection is awesome! It's sit-down restaurant quality at half the price! Give it a try!

This place was conveniently located in a residential community near a business park and a few hotels. The prices for food are reasonable. The beers are a little higher then expected, but doable. There is a salsa bar with free chips. The food lacked the flavors I was looking for, but it was edible. I would return based off walkability, but not based of desired flavors. If you enjoy Mexican food, but like a more bland flavor. This place is for you.
New ownership  & new name. Nice owners. Food good except too much sodium. Combos with white rice, black beans. Little salsa bar.

Delicious hard shell tacos. Chicken is my favorite. Unlimited salsa & chips there & to take home. Love the medium salsa. Happy Hour from 3:00-5:30 at least Monday through Friday. Tuesday is until 9. Definitely check it out. It's worth it.
Always open late. The location is cozy and there is actually a parking lot, rare in this area. I've been coming here for my burritos for over a year and I've never had a bad one.

I have eaten here several times, very funky cool vibe, young staff, kind of a youthful vibe. People in this neighborhood love it. Off busy 4th St, in a cool walk-and-shop area, pretty cute!🤙
They have outdoor seating, but this is a funky neighborhood, so be aware. Conveniently right across from the bar, should you feel the need for a cocktail 👀👌💯

Small lot. Food is fresh and quite delicious, I come for the chicken tacos. The credit card machine was down so that was inconvenient...there is an atm in the liquor store across the street though. Overall I enjoyed my experience, I've been coming here for years.
Great tacos, especially for the price. The ensenada fish tacos were great. Eat them over some chips so they catch the juices and extra fillings that fall out.

Value for money. Has vegetarian options too.
Crunchy potato taco is just $0.89 and super tasty.

The pizza here is great. I remember coming here after finals or mid terms to eat with friends after very difficult exams. The slices are pretty big and two people can’t finish one large pizza. 
The service is great and they serve alcohol. It’s always packed but that’s because the food is really good. I think they just started taking debit cards but it use to be cash only. Great pizza place.
They offer an app as an easier way to order. But require you to stand in the long line in order to pick the food up. The purpose of ordering ahead of time is to skip the line.
Great place to for a quick dine in or u could call your order ahead for pick up. Great prices and friendly quick service.I had the beef ravioli it was great.
Food was delicious. Great customer service! Will definitely be going back.

food is a amazing but the pizza can be inconsistent; too thin and greasy at times, occasionally they'll line the toppings under the cheese which my kids hate, and other times the pizza is actually perfect. the lunch specials (m-f, 10a-3p) usually make for perfect slices, and the pasta specials (all day) -they post the weeks daily pasta specials on instagram- are usually amazing. good luck with your pizzas!
Always a great place to dine with a large group of people, very nice people. Great customer service.
Eating dog food is better than eating here.
Old school Cambodian food. This place used to be New Paradise restaurant. Food is good. Service is decent as well. I would recommend if you want a casual place to eat Cambodian food.
Food is not authentic Khmer food but ok as Khmer food mixed with Chinese. Good service and fair price.
Good place to do wedding venues

This place is awesome!  Great quality at affordable prices.  My go to spot for lunch.  Service is self serve so it's convenient.  Not your typical service restaurant.  You order, pay, and pick up at the counter when your number is called.  That's probably how they keep their cost low.
I really like the sushi mix plates with the tempura veggies and shrimp. So GOOD! Great place for small groups and hanging out. I definitely reccomend.
The price has increased which is fine, but for 13.00 I would expect not to buss my own table. Food is still good.
This place is delicious. It does get a bit packed sometimes but it's worth it. I get the number 8. Highly recommend it

Always good food. Well prepared. Sometimes I take out because it can get crowded depending on the rush hour. Plenty of space for parking. Also they have 2 TVs on with sports, normally European soccer. People are friendly there.

I will definitely be coming back here! I tried 2 new things that were really interesting. One is the spicy seaweed salad which was actually quite good and a roll with banana in it which was amazing! I also loved the detail on the menus and how they were comics.
Always a treat when in Long Beach. Fresh and full of flavor. Staff is inviting and friendly. Great place.
Great experience! Great food and staff! Definitely taking my family to this place
The BEST!!! Fresh sushi, great staff, greater service. Regular spot of mine.

Great rolls for vegans, not a huge variety but delicious. 
I've been here about five times since my first review and it only gets better. Friendly staff, well prepared food, quick service, youthful atmosphere. Definitely worth a few visit!

So delicious! The service was outstanding! Everyone was so kind, and we got our food quickly. The Falafel is the best I've ever had! They're hummus is delicious! And they're fries are so good. I would 100% recommend this restaurant. We loved everything about it, and will definitely be back again! This is something we will be craving once we go back home.

The food is good and service is excellent, also they are pet friendly you can bring your small dog into the front patio with you, large dogs have to be on the outside of  the patio. This location is great for couples, friends and families there are other eating establishments all down the street as well as various stores.  Metered parking is also available, we paid $1.50 for a hour and a half of parking. There's plenty to do in the area, shopping, dining, touring, biking, water sports, bar hoping you name it. Enjoy.

Love the service and the food!  Our server, Simon, was charming and attentive.  We had the family buffet option which is available when you have at least 4 people. They brought out the full course gamut of meals for us to feast on, I wish I took pictures.  Great location with 3 places in Long Beach and seating us was very quick.

Wow, Georges Greek Cafe...... After a 5 year hiatus I finally made it back to the promised land!! Jonny our server was excellent - 4 stars! After a slew of appetizers, He guided our table to 2 of the best dishes I've ever had: the goat stew & the rotisserie pork shoulder. Incredible. Even filtered our wine after noticing some slight residue, and we came to really appreciate his attention to detail throughout the course of our visit. (Introduced us to the world of the coffee fortune!)
The ambiance, the food, and the service will keep me raving about this gem of a restaurant. Cheers and cant wait to be back.
Our waiter waiter I believe name is Kyle. Every time we dine here he's always pleasant and he takes good care of his customers. And our little 6 lb dog is always welcomed. Food is greet.

This place has the best Lebanese/Mediterranean food. Jad, the server helped us for 2 nights in a row for dinner was great, courteous and helpful. We are visiting from AZ, next time we're in town this place will be on our list. We'll be back again and I recommend it.
The food was good. Service not so much. Had hot water spilled on me. The only phone who seemed to care was the waitress, probably because I screamed.
Great food-- used to be even better when they were making their own pita bread

One of the BEST restaurants in Long Beach. Bruno treats all of his guests like they are family. The spicy lamb kafta and the garlic sauce is my favorite.  The bread is baked fresh-to-order and delivered in about 5 minutes.  Bruno has the BEST Turkish Coffee I have EVER enjoyed.  If you are a people watcher, you will LOVE the patio seating.

They make their own pita bread, yum. I love hummus and they make it fresh daily. I've tried a few Lebanese restaurants but this one is my favorite by far. It has cool decor and and they keep everything very clean.  The wait staff is nice and the food is just amazing.

555, or the 5 as the locals call it, is a fantastic steakhouse sit down restaurant that has amazing service as well as outstanding food. They get you seated quickly, fed fast, and left happy. The waiters are very kind and understanding of allergies and special requests for your orders. They also have an absolutely delicious desert menu with many choices to satisfy your sweet tooth. The 5 is a definite must go for any date night or special occasion!

My wife and I were in town for a dance competition at the convention center.  We didnt have a chance to celebrate our anniversary, or valentine's day due to busy schedules.  We stopped by to have a drink in the bar in the afternoon after walking around and going to the beach  and it was very warm and inviting.  So i thought this would be a nice place to have dinner and celebrate.

I talked to the bartender and the waitress (they were awesome) about surprising my wife at dinner.  To say the least they did not disappoint at all.  We walked in for dinner and were quickly seated and at the table was a dozen red Rose's and a chilled bottle of champagne.  The smile on my wife's face was absolutely priceless.  

To the bartender and my waitress working the afternoon on 3/15/2019 (I'm horrible at remembering names) thank you from the bottom of my heart.  They weren't even on shift when we came back for dinner, but they made the night unforgettable!!!

This is by far one of the best steak houses I have ever been to. The food is always fresh and top notch! Yes, they are on the pricey side, but you are getting the best USDA Prime beef in the world. I highly recommend the Goat cheese appetizer and the Apple Crumble dessert!!

Been here a couple of times and both times had to wait for my reservation. Otherwise food is great, service is even better! Took pops for his bday and we had a great time and waitress took good care of us. I would come back again!  Too busy eating to take pics of my good. ;)

Great steak in Long Beach. I'm from Oklahoma, and I like you think I know great beef. The Triple Nickel not THE best, but it is REALLY darn good.

We arrived a bit before our reservation with a large party, so we had a drink at the bar. Bartender was personable & drinks were good. 

Once we were seated we had a really nice server, and she had a firm grasp of the menu and what everything meant. She also did not try to oversell every little thing, which is important to me.

Everyone at the table had a steak from the dry aged menu (priced by the ounce), and it was worth it. I had the rib-eye, black & blue (charred outside/raw inside), and I was not disappointed. The marbling was just about perfect and the dry aging made each bite as tender as a filet. 

Had sauteed mushrooms & onions on the side and they were good as well. Grilled asparagus and the sauteed spinach were both nicely prepared & the table shared them.

One out of six had a steak that was a little overcooked, but he didn't want to send it back, so that's on him, not the restaurant in my opinion.

I do look forward to my next visit.

Dang the food is really really good. However there's something strange about staff. I think the manager needs to be replaced. I've been here two days and many people seem to be just not very people first. The workers are ok just not very friendly. 
The food is hot, delicious and flavorful. The chef and cook staff obviously know what they are doing. They even managed to get extra crispy bacon on my dad's burger when he asked for it. Speaking of burger it was one of the best I've had. The kids burger is also ridiculously delicious and huge. The battered fries are yummy! 
The green soup had really good spice and the clam chowder is exactly how I like it (which is on the slightly more liquid side) my potato dish was smoking hot and the cheese curds were so yummy. The sauce with it was super flavorful.
We had a club sandwich and the meat inside was super thick and the sandwich was huge!  
The ship museum right outside was the highlight of my some lunch. He loved getting up and seeing the models right outside the restaurant
I love the food here. I got the street tacos because I was craving some Mexican food. It was quite good and for some of the other entrees, the portions are very large.

Terrible experience here. I came with my family to this "restaurant" with no expectations and was still disappointed. I asked for medium poached eggs and got eggs cooked all the way through like a hard boiled egg. I asked for a medium rare steak and got a dry, medium steak with unrendered fat and way to much Lawry's/salt. Sausages tasted like soy sausages. My father commented that when he goes to a restaurant that "the cook should be as good as, or better than me at cooking" and that this was clearly not the case for this place. Overall, I would avoid this restaurant and go literally anywhere else, even a Jack-in-the-Box, to get a much better meal for a much more reasonable price. Stay away from the Promenade Cafe.
This place has incredible food especially the eggs benedict with crab.
The French toast was wonderful but they were out if the veggie sausage 😞

I had a solo dinner here tonight in between phases of an event I was attending. Service was great. I ordered the wedge (I can't help it- I love those things!) And the crispy skin salmon with shaved cucumbers and pickled ginger. I could have done without the ginger but the cucumbers, sauce and salmon were flavored really well. The salmon was *just* this side of too done but I was pretty hungry and with the cucumbers and sauce it was fine. I don't know who claimed the portions are too small but both my salad and the salmon were PLENTY of food. I *did* watch a couple of bigger guys not finish their lobster rolls, so you might be wary of ordering that. Also- it's quite dark. I saw more than one person using their phones to read the menu. It's nothing fancy, really like an old side deck transformed into a restaurant.

Prices are very high and the quality of the food and the serving sizes are not very good. I had the crispy skin salmon. It was ok, slightly over cooked. My wife had the surf and turf burger it was nothing to write home about. My kid had the chicken fingers and fries. They were definitely something from Costco.  The concept is neat but if they want to keep the Queen Mary a sustainable and profitable business they need to improve the quality.

This restaurant is fantastic, I had the opportunity to come with all my family to celebrate a birthday and they treated us super. the dishes are produced with fine ingredients, you have a flavor that takes you to the same sky. the attention of the waiters is excellent. cleanliness and impeccable service. It is a place with a pleasant atmosphere and very easy to find parking. If you are looking for a place to impress someone, this is the ideal restaurant.

Excellent food, friendly and attentive service, large portions, and reasonable prices given that it's housed in a major tourist attraction. In other words, everything to like and nothing to dislike. The views of the harbour are also outstanding.  Reservations are a good idea.
Steak was cooked perfectly & the sides were amazing. The table bread alone was worth the price of admission. Service was friendly, attentive and fast.
